;上海细胞培育肉类初创公司 CellX 推出中国首个培育肉类试点周三，该工厂在该国寻求可持续动物蛋白来源以养活其人口方面取得了重大突破。

;

;该试点工厂代表着在大规模生产之前将人造肉送上餐桌又近了一步，联合创始人兼首席执行官杨子良在接受采访时表示。

;

;杨说，上海工厂拥有一个 2,000 升的生物反应器，每年可生产“个位数吨”的养殖肉，还有更多很快就会添加生物反应器。

;

;“该试点设施的见解将用于我们计划在 2025 年完工的商业生产设施，[该设施]将能够生产数百吨产品杨说。

;

;作为减少进口依赖战略的一部分，确保 14 亿人口（约占世界人口的五分之一）的粮食安全已成为中国的首要任务之一。< /p>;

;2022年5月，作为“十四五”发展规划的一部分，北京表示支持发展合成蛋白作为食物来源，以减轻传统畜牧业对环境资源的压力。生物经济。在此之前，一月份纳入了实验室培育的肉类和其他替代蛋白质，以确保可持续的食品供应。

;

;Yang 表示，该试点设施将有助于将 CellX 的生产成本降低至每磅 100 美元以下。他表示，这使其与优质肉类具有竞争力，并补充说 CellX 的商业生产设施将于 2025 年投入使用，这将进一步降低成本。

;

;相比之下，一磅 A5 级日本和牛神户牛肉的售价约为 189 美元

;

;“事实上，我们能够进行试点并将成本降低到每磅 100 美元以下，这确实是一个重要的里程碑，标志着从研发到生产的过渡，”杨说。 “工业化和商业化是我们接下来关注的重点。”

;

;今年晚些时候，CellX 计划与美国和新加坡的食品监管机构接洽，批准其产品在 2025 年在其他国际市场销售。

;

;6 月，Upside Foods 和 Good Meat 获得美国农业部批准销售实验室培育肉类，美国成为继新加坡之后第二个允许销售培育肉类的国家。< /p>;

;人造肉是通过直接培养动物细胞生产的，无需饲养动物作为食物。

;

;新加坡于 2020 年 12 月允许销售人造肉，当时初创公司 Eat Just 收到了获得在该城邦销售其实验室生产的鸡肉的批准。

;

;CellX 于 2021 年 9 月首次推出了细胞猪肉产品样品，其培育肉产品采用了多品种方法。

;

;CellX 于 2021 年 9 月首次推出了细胞猪肉产品样品。 p>;

;CellX 成立于 2020 年，已获得约 2000 万美元的四轮投资，战略投资者包括中国联想控股支持的佳沃资本和韩国企业集团 SK 集团。

;

;CellX 于 2022 年 4 月与柏林的 Bluu Seafood 签署战略合作伙伴关系，帮助两家公司推动监管合规性并扩大中国和欧洲市场消费者对实验室培育蛋白质产品的接受度。

;香港中文大学（中大）校长，争议并不陌生随着立法者着手改革该机构的理事会，段崇智再次成为批评的目标。

;

;这位 72 岁的教授本月多次拒绝出席立法会委员会并面临质询治理问题引发了要求他下台的呼声。他说自己病了。

;

;前市领导梁振英长期持批评态度，从未停止批评段在2019年处理学生抗议的方式，他对他拒绝会见立法会议员感到非常恼火，以至于他说：“他应该重新考虑自己在大学的地位。”

;

;去年 4 月，大学理事会决定重新任命段先生，新的三年任期将于 2026 年结束后，事件迅速展开。立刻遭到批评，并出人意料地改革立法会。

;

;立法会议员张宇人、刘国勋和邓家彪本身都是立法会议员，提出了一项私人议员法案，以削减预算他们希望将外部成员与内部成员的比例从目前大致均匀的比例提高到2:1，并提议校长的任命需要不少于四分之三的校董会成员批准，而不是目前的简单多数。

;

;中大校董会去年12月作出回应，成立了一个专责小组，并决定4月份，自2016年以来一直处于休眠状态的改革计划仍然适合实施。它建议削减立法会规模，包括审查是否可以减少目前任命为咨询机构的三名立法会议员的人数。

;

;尽管立法会认可了2016年的建议，但张、刘和邓仍继续推进他们的计划。自己提议通过私人议员法案重组理事会，要求大学承担所产生的费用。

;

;该法案的反对者质疑将大学内部事务提交立法机关的方式，并警告称这可能会侵蚀学术自由。

;

;但三名立法会议员指出，这些建议很大程度上反映了大学自2016年以来的改革计划。

;

;香港中文大学的段崇智'躲避立法会议员质问

;

;尽管部分立法会议员表示不满，立法会条例草案委员会仍继续审议拟议法例。每次段先生未能露面，他都会再次受到批评，并建议他应该离开。

;

;大学毕业典礼（由所有毕业生组成的法定机构）主席杨宇明（Kelvin Yeung Yu-ming）和中大校董会成员林伟雄和向树辉于7月22日在网上发起请愿，游说反对该法案。

;

;中大校友向先生表示，立法会议员似乎更专注于攻击段先生。

;

;“没有辩论，他们一致谴责一个人，”他说。

;

;大约 9 天之内，大约 1,600 人签署了请愿书，呼吁立法者否决该法案。其中包括香港故宫文化博物馆馆长吴志华和政府流行病顾问许树昌等知名人士。

;

;尽管中大校董会本月批准了专责小组的改革建议，但他们未经立法会批准，该法案无法生效。

;

;预计将于 11 月向立法会提交的三名议员的法案将获得通过，这似乎是不可避免的。

;

;整个法案也是如此。校董会改革事件真的是关于自2018年1月起担任中大校长的人吗？

;

;香港立法会可能援引特别权力调查校董会

;

;

;

;国际知名生物医学科学家香港人段在2019年的社会动乱中受到批评，当时他被指责过于同情学生抗议者。

;

;他在校园里遇到了一群人，一次Point发表了一封公开信，其中列出了他的学生所描述的警方虐待行为，并呼吁政府对虐待指控进行独立调查。

;

;这遭到了警察团体的谴责，他们指责中大“ ”。

;

;同年，英国《泰晤士高等教育》增刊将他评为世界上最有影响力的学者之一，并赞扬他“坚持自己的观点”。校园和学生”。

;

;去年四月，他再次被任命为三年，遭到了批评者的强烈抗议。该大学解释说，启动求职需要时间，招聘过程可能至少需要 12 至 18 个月。

;

;然后，去年 10 月，该大学推出了简化的拆分方案，引发了新的争议-彩色中国凤凰徽章，作为今年庆祝建校 60 周年的“品牌重塑活动”的一部分。

;

;公众和立法者的负面反应非常强烈，以至于该大学在短短一周内就放弃了新设计

;

;一些立法者很快表示，该事件反映了大学的治理不善。

;

;在立法会法案委员会最近的一次会议上，柴逸超教授表示，去年五月接任中大校董会主席时透露，大学管理层并没有要求校董会批准更改校徽。

;

;他又表示，目前未能取得有关校董会条款的资料。 Tuan的新合同。柴智明的前任梁乃鹏领导下的市议会延长了副校长的任期。

;

;前市领导梁振英表示：“很明显，香港特区政府一贯存在不服从命令的行为。”段教授和兼任理事会秘书的大学秘书长。”

;

;中大没有回应《华盛顿邮报》采访段的请求。

;

;大学理事会支持改革，但没有回应全力支持香港立法会议员计划

;

;

;

;中大于1963年在沙田成立，是沙田唯一一所书院制大学，设有九个学院。

;

;目前，其前四所学院的代表在理事会中拥有 16 个席位，这在一定程度上解释了其成员众多的原因。

;

;大学本身多年来也承认其理事会太大，应该被削减，但它没有采取行动。

;

;对大学治理和管理结构进行改革的呼声可以追溯到2002年的一份政府报告，该报告表明治理机构越小越好。它引用了一份英国报告，建议理事会成员的最佳规模为 25 名。

;

;香港其他政府资助的大学也继续进行改革。

;

;根据唐所准备的文件，其中一所大学中大改革法案的立法者中，城市大学现时校董会人数最少，有 23 名成员，而香港大学有 24 名成员，浸会大学和岭南大学分别有 35 名和 34 名成员。

;

;外部成员与内部成员的比例大约为2:1，除了浸会大学的比例约为1:1，如中大。

;

;2009年，中大校董会建议将成员人数缩减至25名，其中外部成员17名，外部成员8名内部成员。它还希望将立法会代表人数从三名削减至一名。

;

;香港大学严厉打击使其“名誉扫地”的行为

;

;这些建议因受到批评而化为泡影由于缺乏协商，并担心拥有如此多的外部成员可能会损害学术自由。

;

;2016年，该大学再次进行了审查，并建议设立一个由29名成员组成的理事会，其中外部成员占多数，但再次，什么也没做。

;

;去年成立的工作组承认该委员会“显然太大了”，并建议成员人数在 25 至 34 人之间，内部与外部的比例在 1:1.64 之间1：2.13。

;

;还规定，批准任命副校长的门槛应在理事会成员的三分之二至四分之三之间。

;

;理事会重申尽管立法会委员会本月正在审议该法案，但中大在回复《邮报》时表示，它支持专责小组的建议，并“仍然致力于确保大学有一个适合目标并符合最佳实践的治理模式”。

;

;877 支持改革香港中文大学理事会的替代计划

;

;

;

;尽管最近因段副校长缺席立法会法案委员会会议而引发风波，部分议员对针对他进行政治运动的建议不予理睬。

;

;委员会主席梁美芬表示：“我们不是针对一个人。有些人可能真的希望他辞职，但他是否应该留下来，应该由新的[改革后]议会决定。”

;

;她表示，该法案中的建议是温和的，旨在改善政府的管理。该法案的支持者指出，该大学在 2022-23 学年至 2024-25 学年期间获得了约 138 亿港元（17.6 亿美元）的经常性公共资金，并表示应该

;

;唐说，三人继续前进的主要原因有两个：其他大学已经做出改变，而中大最近发生的事件表明需要改革。

;

;“我们是其中的一部分作为大学理事会的一员，我们非常重视大学理事会的形象，其中包括大学管理层的成员。” “如果你留意法案委员会，我们三位议员并没有针对任何特定的学校行政官员发表任何评论。”

;

;他并不担心这起事件会影响大学的声誉。

;

; >;

;中文大学校董会成员敦促香港立法者推迟修例法案

;

;资深中国问题观察家、香港中文大学荣休教授、北京半官方智库港侨联会顾问刘兆佳港澳研究表示，不幸的是，许多人将段在 2019 年处理学生抗议者的方式与大学的治理联系起来。

;

;但显然，段在骚乱期间的行为并没有被忘记。

;

;“很多人对段教授处理校园抗议的方式不满意，”刘说。

;

;“理工大学在 2019 年也被激进暴徒占领。但该校校长，与段教授不同，滕锦光教授被认为并不同情抗议者。”

;

;中大校友、资深议员香是反对该法案的请愿者之一，他仍然对立法者的方式感到愤怒谈及中大的管治问题。

;

;「从2002年至2022年，在柴逸超教授出任中大校董会主席之前，所有校董会主席及校董会成员均与中大关系良好”，他说。

;

;他注意到那段时期取得的许多进步，包括在中国大陆建立了大学教学医院和校区。

;

;“如果你说我们治理不善，议会和大学互相争吵，我们怎么能做这么多事情呢？”

;

;同为立法会议员的林恩德坚称，他们并不反对改革，但对法案背后的三名立法者绕过立法会感到不满，而且立法者忽视了立法会2016年检讨报告中达成的共识。

;

;虽然法案通过似乎已成定局，但林郑月娥表示：“我不会说我们失败了，因为我们已经帮助公众了解了立法会改革被强行推进的真相。 ”

;

;至于在整个事件中扮演重要角色的中大校长，香港理工大学专上学院政治学家陈伟强表示，段先生看起来很糟糕。显然他拒绝出席立法会法案委员会的听证会，这给愤怒的立法者提供了攻击他的借口。

;

;“我并不是说他作为大学校长的日子屈指可数，但很少有人会预计他未来的日子会很长。”一帆风顺，”他说。 “他可能会承受更大的压力。”

;

;中国建成超薄煤层开采强力机器，产量创历史新高随着国家转向难以开采的化石燃料矿床以确保能源安全，煤层采煤机由中国煤炭技术工程集团公司上海研究院 (CCTEG) 开发据官方媒体报道，可在薄至 1.3 米（4.3 英尺）的煤层上使用。

;

;中国大陆的主要煤矿公司已部署了 70 多台该机器。< /p>;

;据官方报纸《科技日报》周二报道，在中国国家能源集团运营的一座矿山中，该装置的年产量达到了前所未有的 260 万吨（290 万吨）。< /p>;

;中国因电力安全担忧和气候目标面临风险而铲煤：绿色和平组织

;

;其设计年产能为 300 万吨，是用于开采薄煤层的类似机器产量的三倍。这些竞争对手的设备也无法在厚度小于 1.6 米的煤层中作业。

;

;该机器的装机功率为 1,200 千瓦，比竞争对手更强大。该设备可以调整方向和高度，高精度定位控制技术引导其运动。

;

;有关该设备的报道于7月下旬首次出现在中国官方媒体上。

;

;随着相对较厚煤层和有利地质条件的矿区逐渐枯竭，中国的煤炭开采状况一直在恶化。

;

;中国将焦点重新放在能源和排放目标上，以实现后疫情时代的反弹

;

;总部位于北京的能源与气候研究机构 Agora Energy Transition China 董事总经理 Kevin Tu 表示，为了维持中国不断增长的煤炭消费量，矿工们必须找到开采更薄煤层的方法。

;

;北京出于可持续发展的原因放弃煤炭，承诺到 2030 年实现净零排放，到 2060 年实现净零排放。

;

;但出于能源安全考虑，过去两年又重新转向煤炭。

;< p>;我国煤炭消耗量占世界一半以上，煤炭长期以来一直是国家经济发展的主要能源。

;

;屠呦呦表示，虽然中国正在经历清洁能源转型，但煤炭- 依赖能源结构不可能一蹴而就。

;

;不过，他表示，对于中国实现碳中和目标而言，从中长期来看，逐步淘汰煤炭仍然是不可避免的，并补充说，技术的发展该国煤炭开采活动的减少不会改变这一趋势。

;

;“石器时代并没有结束，因为世界上的石头用完了，石油时代也不会因为我们用完了石油而结束，”他补充道。

;

;中国煤炭的大量产于薄煤层，约占中国煤炭总储量的 20%，即高达 3500 亿吨，CCTEG 上海经理李庆良表示。研究院对内地媒体表示。

;

;然而，由于开采条件差、盈利能力低，薄煤层的产量仅占全国煤炭总产量的7%左右。

;

;新矿机的出现正值中国加快可再生能源发电设施安装以实现脱碳目标之际。

;

;中国在发展可再生能源方面取得了巨大进展。到 2022 年，它占全球新增可再生能源容量的 49%。迄今为止，中国在电动汽车上路方面也处于领先地位。

;

;但中国也是全球二氧化碳排放量最大的来源国，去年排放量为 12.1 十亿吨，是美国排放量的两倍多国家和几乎全球总数的三分之一。这很大程度上是因为中国仍然是世界上最大的煤炭生产国和消费国。

;

;A new trend for using fake belly buttons, breasts and buttocks among Chinese women has raised concerns about body image issues on mainland social media.

;

;The latest fake body part to take off are fake belly buttons. Similar to temporary tattoos, the adhesive sticker is placed on the stomach a few centimetres above the actual navel, which is obscured, creating the illusion of longer legs that is widely perceived as more attractive, reported news outlet City Link.

;

;On Pinduoduo, one of China's largest online shopping platforms, the top-selling merchant offers two sheets of 32 navel stickers for less than 4 yuan (55 US cents) and has already taken 4,400 orders, according to the shop's online sales figures.

;

;The sticker's popularity is evident among women on the social media platform Xiaohongshu.

;

;“Every summer, I always feel troubled. I really want to wear stylish and sexy outfits, but I'm held back by my body shape – they just don't look good on me, and I lack the confidence,” said one woman.

;

;“However, these stickers are not easy to drop off; they're non-reflective and even waterproof. I'm willing to call them the most successful invention of 2023!”

;

;On Douyin, another woman declared: “This isn't just a fake belly button sticker; it's a 'cheating tool' for bidding farewell to my 50-50 body proportion.”

;

;Many people have also shared tips for making the stickers appear more authentic such as using makeup powder to blend the stickers with the surrounding skin colour.

;

;Fake belly button stickers are not the only beauty-enhancing tools gaining popularity on social media in China; fake breasts, fake buttocks, fake shoulders, fake collarbones and even fake noses are now readily available online.

;

;Fake buttocks supposedly can create a lifted appearance to a person's backside and enhance the body's natural curves while fake shoulders can make narrow shoulders look broader, creating the “right-angled shoulder” shape currently popular in fashion and beauty circles online.

;

;However, beneath the excited online discussion among fans of the new generation of fake body parts, concerns have been raised that they may also exacerbate appearance-related anxieties for some women.

;

;“I wonder how these women can still face their true body figures after removing the fake belly button stickers, breast pads, buttock pads, and other enhancements,” observed one critic of the products online.

;

;Fashion and relationship influencer, widely known as Miss Nan, who has more than 2 million followers on Weibo, said that for many women, the products made them feel confident online when presenting themselves in the same way beauty-enhancing apps have been doing for years.

;

;“The more functional these products are, the more popular they become. The underlying psychology here is hard to ignore and the reality is that beauty holds significant importance in people's lives,” she said.

;

;In response to concerns about appearance-related anxieties and the use of these products, Miss Nan said that most women would undergo what she called a process of “growth”, gaining an increased maturity as they aged and placing less value on physical appearance.

;

;“The joy and praise brought by physical beauty can be irresistible, but as age increases, even the most advanced cosmetic technologies cannot defy time. Women will definitely find other sources of happiness,” she said.

; Thu, 10 Aug 2023 09:50:02 +0800 Indonesians riled after top cop escapes death penalty for murder, but activists say he has ‘right to live’https://www.scmp.com/week-asia/people/article/3230553/indonesians-riled-after-top-cop-escapes-death-penalty-murder-activists-say-he-has-right-live?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.10 09:30;
;;

;Indonesia's top court on Tuesday commuted the death sentence of a police official who killed his aide, a decision that has triggered disbelief and raised questions in the country about the transparency of the legal process.

;

;Ferdy Sambo, a former two-star general and head of Indonesia's internal affairs department, was found guilty of premeditated murder after his bodyguard, 27-year-old Brigadier Nofriansyah Yosua Hutabarat, was shot dead at Sambo's Jakarta home in July last year.

;

;The case gripped the nation, and its ensuing trial was widely seen as a test of police accountability.

;

;Sambo received the maximum sentence in February, a ruling widely viewed as a sign of justice for Hutabarat and his family. But the Supreme Court's decision on Tuesday to commute Sambo's sentence to life in prison on appeal led many people to express their disappointment on social media.

;

;Widodo urges 'transparent' probe as murder case rocks faith in Indonesian police

;

;Berlian Simarmata, a lecturer in criminal law at Santo Thomas Catholic University in Medan, said while the decision was not what people wanted to hear, it was “still within the corridor of the law” and under the authority of the Supreme Court.

;

;“Legally, there is nothing wrong with the Supreme Court's decision, but materially people will have different opinions about the verdict,” he said.

;

;He added that according to Indonesia's new Criminal Code that will be phased in by 2026, Sambo would be able to apply to have his life term commuted to 20 years after he serves a minimum of 15 years behind bars, meaning he is likely to be eligible for release in the future.

;

;The Supreme Court also reduced the sentences of Sambo's co-accused, with his wife Putri Candrawathi's 20-year jail time halved. Her assistant Kuat Ma'ruf's sentence was cut from 15 years to 10 years, and police officer Ricky Rizal Wibowo's 13-year sentence was shortened to eight years. Another police officer Richard Eliezer Pudihang Lumiu received an 18-month sentence at the original trial and was paroled on August 4.

;

;Sambo's case takes place amid a trying period for Indonesia's police force, which already has a reputation for corruption, cronyism and extrajudicial violence.

;

;Just before Sambo's trial started last October, police fired tear gas at football fans at Kanjuruhan stadium in the city of Malang, resulting in a deadly crush that left 135 people dead, including young children.

;

;In March this year, two police officers involved in the tear gas incident were found not guilty on charges of negligence leading to injury and death, while a third was sentenced to just 18 months in prison.

;

;Jacqui Baker, a fellow of the Indo-Pacific Research Centre at Murdoch University in Australia, said that while Sambo's trial had been held up as a litmus test of police accountability, it had obscured the case at Kanjuruhan stadium in Malang, where hundreds died in a crush that had involved many police officers, highlighting the systemic violence carried out by the Indonesian force.

;

;“The police orchestrated Sambo's trial like a soap opera and a case of good cop versus bad cop to distract from wider structural issues within Indonesia's police force,” Baker said.

;

;As a result, the commutation of the death sentence could be viewed as a further sign of continued police impunity in Indonesia and a lack of accountability when Indonesian police officers use violence to deadly effect, she added.

;

;“It also just rubs salt in the wounds of the victims of Kanjuruhan,” she said.

;

;Indonesia's police scandals have got Jokowi's goat, but will officers be cowed?

;

;It is still unclear what led to the shooting of Hutabarat at Sambo's home, although prosecutors at the trial suggested that Hutabarat had been having an affair with Sambo's wife. Sambo and Candrawathi claimed that Hutabarat had tried to sexually assault Candrawathi and had been the first to fire shots at Sambo when he confronted him.

;

;Usman Hamid, director of Amnesty Indonesia, said that public sentiment had been divided regarding Sambo's death sentence, but that “dominant public opinion had wanted to see him executed”.

;

;But he said that Amnesty Indonesia supported the judge's decision to commute the sentence.

;

;“We agree that Sambo's actions constituted a serious crime, especially considering his capacity as head of internal affairs. However, even though he needed to be severely punished, we think that he still had the right to live,” he said.

;

;“All forms of crimes prohibited by international law committed by state apparatus must be punished, but must still be fair, without having to impose the death penalty, which is an outdated punishment.”

;

;Capital punishment remains part of the Indonesian legal system for a range of crimes including premeditated murder, drug trafficking, corruption and terrorism.

;As we approach International Youth Day, it is crucial to acknowledge and celebrate the distinctive qualities and contributions that young people make for our global society, knitting the world more closely together.

;The first International Youth Day, celebrated on August 12, 2000, was designated by the United Nations to raise awareness of youth. This year's theme is “Green Skills for Youth: Towards a Sustainable World”.

;

;The concept of youth can be nebulous. It is often classified as those aged between 15 and 24 years, a group of around 1.2 billion that forms 16 per cent of the world's populace. Strikingly, more than half of the global population is under the age of 30. However, a mere 2.6 per cent of parliamentarians worldwide fall into this age group.

;

;Despite such paltry political representation, young people continue to reach for the forefront, employing innovative strategies to tackle a gamut of global challenges from climate crises to the governance of technology. Young people have the potential to catalyse positive change and make a substantial impact.

;

;Youth networks and social impact organisations, such as the UN Sustainable Development Solutions Network, One Young World and Global Shapers Community, kindle global movements and foster new waves of globalisation.

;

;In spite of overarching geopolitical tensions and the rather grim global macroeconomic outlook – particularly given the strain in Sino-US relations – these global youth networks are poised to champion globalisation and cooperation, grappling with the world's challenges.

;

;Several esteemed organisations and nominations, including Forbes 30 Under 30, offer recognition for the achievements of young people, acknowledging their entrepreneurial spirit and impact. Such recognition has spurred a proliferation of start-ups and innovative solutions across diverse sectors, from renewable energy to healthcare and education.

;

;In furthering the humanitarian agenda, such as the UN's Sustainable Development Goals, young people around the world are characterised by their entrepreneurial zeal, which is instrumental in propelling the next wave of globalisation.

;

;It encourages collaboration and the exchange of ideas across borders. Many young entrepreneurs are not only forging new businesses but also catalysing social change and contributing to global development by addressing urgent issues such as climate change, poverty and inequality.

;

;Furthermore, global youth networks and leadership initiatives, such as the Rhodes and Schwarzman scholarships, are shaping a cadre of globally conscious and empathetic scholars and emerging leaders, undeterred by the geopolitical climate.

;

;Networks that can navigate the global uncertainty, accommodate diverse talents and maintain neutrality will emerge as leadership powerhouses.

;

;These diverse communities exemplify the acceleration of collective action through global solidarity and people power. They champion global causes, transcending national borders and rivalries, and emphasise collaboration over bloc politics and nationalism.

;

;More importantly, these networks engage young peacebuilders in countering extremism, and clearly position young people as important partners in the global effort. Lastly, the cultural sensitivity and technological literacy among the youth population will be vital qualities for the globally minded civic leaders of the future.

;

;Young people's ability to lead the next wave of globalisation is largely due to their increased access to education and technology. The global youth literacy rate has risen considerably, and more are pursuing higher education than ever.

;

;According to a Unesco survey last year, more than 90 per cent of young people plan to pursue higher education. This is a generation that is becoming more knowledgeable, skilled and prepared to handle the challenges of an increasingly interconnected world.

;

;Hong Kong's young talent is a strength that must be strategically nurtured

;

;As arguably the most tech-savvy generation in history, they've grown up with the internet, smartphones and social media, which are revolutionising communication and information sharing. With over 85.5 per cent of the world population owning smartphones, young people are continually exposed to different cultures, languages and perspectives, which can foster a sense of global citizenship.

;

;This technological literacy will be invaluable as the world becomes even more interconnected, allowing young people to collaborate and innovate in new ways, and to embrace diversity more than any previous generation. They will be pivotal change agents as we traverse in the fourth industrial revolution.

;

;Openness and tolerance will be crucial in the next wave of globalisation, facilitating the free exchange of ideas, knowledge and innovation across borders and generations. It will also contribute to a more inclusive and equitable global society, ensuring equal opportunities for all.

;The former boss of Hong Kong stock exchange, Charles Li Xiaojia, on Wednesday said wider adoption of advanced technology such as facial recognition has the potential to enhance mobility in the Greater Bay Area (GBA), as he shared his vision of a programme that would allow easier travel for businesspeople and other groups within the megalopolis, without violating tax, emigration or labour laws.

;

;“The interconnectivity between Guangdong, Hong Kong and Macau boils down to the exchange of people, money and thoughts,” Li said in a conference organised by Singaporean multinational bank DBS on the GBA development zone, which comprises the two special administrative regions and nine cities in the southern coastal province.

;

;While the internet has helped break the boundaries for thought, the easing of geographical limitations to help people move around would be key to achieving interconnectivity in the GBA, according to Li, the former chief executive of Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing and co-founder of financial technology platform Micro Connect.

;

;Although interconnectivity in finance still has a long way to go, Li indicated that the GBA master plan must remove real-life hindrances and obstacles that impede the mobility of people living in this vast area.

;

;In finance, Li said Hong Kong as well as Macau can serve as connectors between international venture capital and GBA-based companies, especially those involved in hi-tech industries.

;

;“While there is abundant capital domestically, overseas capital can help bring new perspectives and ideas to local innovations, which could have long-term implications for the globalisation of local companies,” he said.

;

;Li's views reflect the growing local and international interest in the GBA, which has been described by some as “the future of Asia”.

;

;Beijing intends to turn the GBA – with a population of more than 80 million people and which accounts for about one-tenth of China's economic output – into a new powerhouse that would surpass the economic heft of the New York Metropolitan Area and Tokyo Bay region by 2035.

;

;Former HKEX CEO's firm launches fundraising platform, raises US$458 million

;

;Earlier this month, Li's Micro Connect officially launched its Macau exchange that aims to help small Chinese companies raise funds.

;

;At the same conference on Wednesday, former Hong Kong chief executive Leung Chun-ying also called for easing limitations that would improve the inflow of mainland people and vehicles to the city.

;

;“The mainland has released bolder GBA policies compared to Hong Kong so far,” Leung said. “The policies should be two-way to fully tap opportunities in the GBA.”

;

;Is China's Greater Bay Area 'the future of Asia'? Top Saudi diplomat weighs in

;

;He indicated that the Hong Kong government can consider setting up non-profit schools for mainland students, whose parents work in the city. Schools specifically for Hongkongers have already been established in various mainland Chinese cities, including one Leung founded in the Nansha district of Guangzhou, capital of Guangdong.

;

;The city's government can also consider opening certain areas on Lantau Island to vehicles from the mainland, according to Leung, after a scheme allowing Hong Kong motorists to cross the border into mainland China in their private cars took effect on July 1.
